alert.note: Alert for Smyth (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 17 at 2:13PM EST until February 18 at 8:53AM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Virginia, including the following county, Smyth. * WHEN...Until 300 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 211 PM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Even though the rain has ended, it will take a few hours for all the runoff to move downstream and into larger rivers. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Campbell Creek, Beaver Creek, Lick Creek, Lynn Camp Creek, Locust Cove Creek, Hungry Mother Creek, Crewey Branch, Middle Fork Holston River and Laurel Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Marion... Saltville... Chilhowie... Hungry Mother State Park... Broadford... Nebo... Quarry... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
